required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate Safety, Efficacy and Tolerability of Clobetasol Propionate for Chronic Hand Dermatitis
clinical_study.official_title: An Open Label Study to Evaluate Safety, Efficacy and Tolerability of Clobetasol Propionate for the Condition of Chronic Hand Dermatitis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to assess the safety, efficacy and tolerability of Clobetasol propionate foam in subjects with chronic dermatitis.

detailed_description.textblock: The study is being conducted in order to obtain safety, efficacy and tolerability data for Clobetasol propionate foam in the treatment of chronic dermatitis. The subjects must have mild to moderate disease based on the Investigator's assessment at baseline.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Subjects With at Least 1-grade Improvement From Baseline to Day 15 in Investigator's Static Global Assessment Score (ISGA) Score
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of Subjects with at least a 1-Grade Improvement from Baseline to Day 15 In Investigator's Static Global Assessment Score (ISGA) - Chronic Hand Dermatitis Please note that the proportion of participants is being reported as a percentage of participants. ISGA grades: Score = 0 (Clear) Score = 1 (Almost Clear) Score = 2 (Mild) Score = 3 (Moderate) Score = 4 (Severe)

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Subjects Who Achieve at Least a 1-grade Improvement Based on the ISGA at Day 8.
secondary_outcome.description: Please note that the proportion of participants is being reported as a percentage of participants. Investigator's Static Global Assessment Score (ISGA) At least 1-grade improvement (%) at Day 8 ISGA grades: Score = 0 (Clear) Score = 1 (Almost Clear) Score = 2 (Mild) Score = 3 (Moderate) Score = 4 (Severe)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Subject's Visual Analogue Assessment Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change in subject's visual analogue assessment scale from baseline to day 8. At each visit, the subject is requested to rate the changes in their skin on the hands on a 1 to 10 scale with 0 being poor and 10 being excellent.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Subjects at Day 15 With at Least 1-Grade Improvement In the Hand Eczema Severity Index Score (HESI) for All Symptoms Present at Baseline Finger Tips
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of subjects at day 15 with at least 1-Grade improvement in the Hand Eczema Severity Index Score (HESI) for all symptoms present at baseline - Finger Tips. The proportion of participants is being reported as a percentage of participants. Each hand was divided into five areas [fingertips, fingers (except the tips), palms, back of hands and wrists]. For each of these areas the intensity of the 6 following clinical signs: erythema, induration, papulation, vesicles, fissuring, scaling and oedema was graded as follows: 0, no skin changes; 1, mild disease; 2, moderate and 3, severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Subjects at Day 8 With at Least 1-Grade Improvement In the Hand Eczema Severity Index Score (HESI) for All Symptoms Present at Baseline Finger Tips

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Subject's Visual Analogue Assessment Scale From Baseline to Day 15
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change in subject's visual analogue assessment scale from baseline to day 15. At each visit, the subject is requested to rate the changes in their skin on the hands on a 1 to 10 scale with 0 being poor and 10 being excellent.

intervention.description: Clobetasol propionate. The study product will be applied topically twice a day (morning and evening) for 14 days of treatment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects 18 years of age or older, with diagnosis of chronic dermatitis, able to complete the study and comply with study instructions.
- Female subjects of childbearing potential must have a negative pregnancy test. Sexually active women of childbearing potential participating in the study must have been using a medically acceptable form of contraception
Exclusion Criteria:
- Use of systemic corticosteroid and/or other prohibited medications within 4 weeks of the baseline visit.
- Use of topical corticosteroid therapy and/or other prohibited topical medications within 2 weeks prior to the baseline visit

clinical_study.keyword: Dermatosis, Dermatitis, Dry skin, Irritated skin

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Recruitment period: First Subject Enrolled October 2008, Last Subject Enrolled January 2009. Type of location: Dermatology Research Center
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Washout from use of systemic corticosteroid and/or other prohibited medications if used within 4 weeks of the baseline visit. Washout from use of topical corticosteroid therapy and/or other prohibited topical medications if used within 2 weeks prior to the baseline visit

group.title: Clobetasol Propionate Foam
group.description: All subjects applied clobetasol propionate 0.05% foam twice a day (morning and evening) to the hands.

group.title: Clobetasol Propionate Foam
group.description: All subjects applied clobetasol propionate 0.05% foam twice a day (morning and evening) to the hands.

measure.title: Age
Age
Gender
Region of Enrollment
ISGA-Chronic Hand Dermatitis
measure.description: Investigators Static Global Assessment (ISGA)- Chronic Hand Dermatitis Score=2 mild Score=3 moderate These are the only scores that are permitted for entry on this study.

measure.title: Time since Diagnosis of Chronic Hand Dermatitis (years)
measure.description: Time since Diagnosis of Chronic Hand Dermatitis, Allergic, Irritant or Contact Dermatitis (years)

measure.title: Total Hand Eczema Severity Index (HESI)
measure.description: Total Hand Eczema Severity Index (total HESI) Score 0 to 360 where 0 is the best and 360 is the worst score.

outcome.population: ITT. Twenty-nine of the 30 subjects enrolled on this study had results for this endpoint on day 8. Thirty of the 30 subjects enrolled had results for this same assessment at the day 15 visit.

group.title: Clobetasol Propionate Foam
group.description: All subjects applied clobetasol propionate 0.05% foam twice a day (morning and evening) to the hands.

measure.title: Proportion of Subjects at Day 15 With at Least 1-Grade Improvement In the Hand Eczema Severity Index Score (HESI) for All Symptoms Present at Baseline Wrists
measure.description: Proportion of Subjects at Day 15 with at least 1-Grade Improvement In the Hand Eczema Severity Index Score (HESI)for All Symptoms Present at Baseline Wrists. The proportion of participants is being reported as a percentage of participants. Each hand was divided into five areas [fingertips, fingers (except the tips), palms, back of hands and wrists]. For each of these areas the intensity of the 6 following clinical signs: erythema, induration, papulation, vesicles, fissuring, scaling and oedema was graded as follows: 0, no skin changes; 1, mild disease; 2, moderate and 3, severe.

outcome.title: Change in Subject’s Visual Analogue Assessment Scale From Baseline to Day 15
outcome.description: Mean change in subject’s visual analogue assessment scale from baseline to day 15. At each visit, the subject is requested to rate the changes in their skin on the hands on a 1 to 10 scale with 0 being poor and 10 being excellent.

group.title: Clobetasol Propionate Foam
group.description: All subjects applied clobetasol propionate 0.05% foam twice a day (morning and evening) to the hands.

measure.title: Change in Subject’s Visual Analogue Assessment Scale From Baseline to Day 15
measure.description: Mean change in subject’s visual analogue assessment scale from baseline to day 15. At each visit, the subject is requested to rate the changes in their skin on the hands on a 1 to 10 scale with 0 being poor and 10 being excellent.

group.title: Clobetasol Propionate Foam
group.description: All subjects applied clobetasol propionate 0.05% foam twice a day (morning and evening) to the hands.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
